author: juvtib
body:
The snap is still at 7.2.2. 

I am getting the new release notification when I open a new PowerShell. 

[Install powershell on Linux | Snap Store](https://snapcraft.io/powershell)

``` PowerShell
> snap refresh --list
All snaps up to date.


> snap info powershell                     
name:      powershell
summary:   PowerShell for every system!
publisher: Microsoft PowerShell✓
store-url: https://snapcraft.io/powershell
contact:   https://github.com/powershell/powershell
license:   unset
description: |
  PowerShell is an automation and configuration management platform.
  It consists of a cross-platform (Windows, Linux, and macOS)
  command-line shell and associated scripting language.
  
  See
  https://docs.microsoft.com/powershell/scripting/powershell-support-lifecycl
  e for support details.
commands:
  - powershell
snap-id:      JSNnoJl3EqkMuWoy5Dgq8PMqZ0uNcpie
tracking:     latest/stable
refresh-date: 36 days ago, at 01:48 CDT
channels:
  latest/stable:    7.2.2 2022-03-22 (202) 70MB classic
  latest/candidate: 7.2.1 2021-12-14 (193) 71MB classic
  latest/beta:      7.2.1 2021-12-14 (193) 71MB classic
  latest/edge:      7.2.1 2021-12-14 (193) 71MB classic
  lts/stable:       7.2.2 2022-03-22 (203) 70MB classic
  lts/candidate:    7.2.0 2021-11-09 (189) 71MB classic
  lts/beta:         7.2.0 2021-11-09 (189) 71MB classic
  lts/edge:         7.2.0 2021-11-09 (190) 71MB classic
installed:          7.2.2            (202) 70MB classic
> 


```

comments.author: juvtib
comments.body:
> sudo -k snap refresh                     
[sudo] password for michael: 
powershell 7.2.3 from Microsoft PowerShell✓ refreshed

comments.author: juvtib
comments.body:
v 7.2.5 has not made it to the Snap store. 

``` bash 
snap list powershell

Name        Version  Rev  Tracking       Publisher              Notes
powershell  7.2.4    208  latest/stable  microsoft-powershell✓  classic

```

title: Snap Not Updated
